isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV) System, March 2007 and Later - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HEATER TRIM COVER

svcprocinfo.para: The heater trim cover must be removed prior to removing any of the HVAC components located under the right side of the instrument panel (IP). Removal and installation of the heater trim cover may require the removal of other trim panels. The panels that must be removed vary by vehicle model and trim level. Refer to the appropriate CAB section(s) in GROUP 16 of the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

note.para: Refer to Figure 29 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Remove fuse panel cover from passenger side instrument panel by pulling top of cover away from IP to release spring clips, then lift cover up.
Remove trim panels, as necessary, to gain access to mounting screws for heater trim cover (1, Figure 29).
Remove nine screws from heater trim cover.
Remove cover by pulling it straight back.
Secure heater trim cover (1, Figure 29) to heater housing with nine screws.
Install all additional trim panels removed to gain access to heater trim cover.
Install fuse panel cover by inserting two tabs at bottom of cover into sockets in IP; then press top of cover toward IP to engage spring clips.
